hungry.headline: At Dawa’s in Queens, a Fusion of Earth and Sky
hungry.name: Dawa’s
hungry.summary: At this Tibetan and American cafe, the thrill is the hidden tracks on the flip side of the menu.
hungry.title: Dawa’s

hungry.headline: A Bit of Brazil Washes Up at Beach Bistro 96 in Queens
hungry.name: Beach Bistro 96
hungry.summary: Croquettes, pastries and other South American snacks from a former pro surfer and his wife.
hungry.title: Beach Bistro 96

hungry.headline: Burmese Food in New York: Hard to Find but Easy to Love
hungry.name: Burmese Bites
hungry.summary: The search ends at two shoe box restaurants, Burmese Bites in Queens and Burma Noodle Bar in Brooklyn.
hungry.title: Burmese Bites

hungry.headline: Phil-Am Kusina, a Ray of Philippine Sun on Staten Island
hungry.name: Phil-Am Kusina
hungry.summary: The son of two North Shore grocers turns out generous portions and big flavors.
hungry.title: Phil-Am Kusina

hungry.headline: The Crabby Shack, a Shrine to the Crustacean
hungry.name: The Crabby Shack
hungry.summary: Crab scuttles all over the menu at a former church in Crown Heights, Brooklyn.
hungry.title: The Crabby Shack

hungry.headline: The Secret to District Saigon’s Broths: Slow Cooking
hungry.name: District Saigon
hungry.summary: A new Vietnamese restaurant in Astoria, Queens, simmers its pho with patience and attention to ingredients.
hungry.title: District Saigon

hungry.headline: Caridad China Revives Old-School Flavor in Williamsburg
hungry.name: Caridad China
hungry.summary: A native of Guangdong brings the flavors of the Caribbean to Brooklyn’s Avenue of Puerto Rico.
hungry.title: Caridad China

hungry.headline: B & K French Cuisine Brings Paris to Harlem
hungry.name: B & K French Cuisine
hungry.summary: With high hopes and no gas, a classically trained chef is on a mission: ‘Fast food doesn’t mean bad food anymore!’
hungry.title: B & K French Cuisine

hungry.headline: West Africa Enlivens the South Bronx, at Nabaya
hungry.name: Nabaya
hungry.summary: The look is demure, but the food has fervor.
hungry.title: Nabaya

hungry.headline: At King of Falafel, the Crown Jewels Are Chickpeas
hungry.name: King of Falafel & Shawarma
hungry.summary: A popular street cart has spawned a new restaurant in Astoria, Queens.
hungry.title: King of Falafel & Shawarma

hungry.headline: A Meal (and History) in a Box at Taiwan Bear House
hungry.name: Taiwan Bear House
hungry.summary: A Chinatown restaurant serves the bento-style meals sold on railways in Taiwan.
hungry.title: Taiwan Bear House

hungry.headline: Angela’s Takes a Return Trip to the Caribbean
hungry.name: Angela’s
hungry.summary: A Bedford-Stuyvesant restaurant is revived by its Guyanese-born chef.
hungry.title: Angela’s

hungry.headline: Russian Dumplings, Like Grandma’s, at Two Village Spots
hungry.name: Babushka Cafe
hungry.summary: Anton’s Dumplings and Babushka Cafe fill their specialties with care and tradition.
hungry.title: Babushka Cafe

hungry.headline: A World of Flavor, Stuffed Into Tacos at El Molcajete
hungry.name: El Molcajete
hungry.summary: This restaurant in Soundview, the Bronx, excels at succulent meats.
hungry.title: El Molcajete

hungry.headline: Bite of Hong Kong Requires More Than a Few Nibbles
hungry.name: Bite of Hong Kong
hungry.summary: The vast menu at a Cantonese restaurant in Chinatown rewards careful study and repeat visits.
hungry.title: Bite of Hong Kong

hungry.headline: A Midas of Meat at BK Jani in Bushwick
hungry.name: BK Jani
hungry.summary: Art and diners’ recommendations fill the walls of this small Pakistani barbecue restaurant in Brooklyn.
hungry.title: BK Jani

hungry.headline: At Tut’s Hub, Egyptian Street Foods Get a Temple
hungry.name: Tut’s Hub Royal Cuisine
hungry.summary: Imposing columns, statues of gods and three stories in Astoria, Queens.
hungry.title: Tut’s Hub Royal Cuisine

hungry.headline: Angkor Cambodian Bistro Explores Southeast Asia, Gently
hungry.name: Angkor Cambodian Bistro
hungry.summary: The Upper East Side restaurant is the third for a former refugee.
hungry.title: Angkor Cambodian Bistro

hungry.headline: Mimi’s Hummus, Spreading Its Middle Eastern Influence
hungry.name: Mimi’s Hummus
hungry.summary: A popular Brooklyn restaurant has expanded to the East Village.
hungry.title: Mimi’s Hummus

hungry.headline: Sauerkraut Rolls and Other Shanghai Surprises at Yaso Tangbao
hungry.name: Yaso Tangbao
hungry.summary: A simple storefront in Downtown Brooklyn specializes in Chinese soup dumplings and nostalgia.
hungry.title: Yaso Tangbao

hungry.headline: Sweet Simplicity at Leche y Miel in the Bronx
hungry.name: Leche y Miel Restaurant
hungry.summary: Pungent island flavors from a couple with roots in the Dominican Republic.
hungry.title: Leche y Miel Restaurant

hungry.headline: Hot Cereal 30 Ways at OatMeals in Greenwich Village
hungry.name: OatMeals
hungry.summary: A cafe serves oats inspired by Asian cuisines, candy and Elvis.
hungry.title: OatMeals

hungry.headline: At Kichin in Brooklyn, Korean Fried Chicken and Mighty Rice Balls
hungry.name: Kichin
hungry.summary: The chef Bryan Moon opened the mostly Korean takeout shop under the Marcy Avenue subway stop in November with his older brother Mike.
hungry.title: Kichin

hungry.headline: Poké Reaches the Shores of Manhattan
hungry.name: Sons of Thunder
hungry.summary: A raw fish salad from Hawaii is finding a home in New York, where it is featured at three restaurants and by a chef dealing it out of a coffee shop that doubles as a karaoke bar.
hungry.title: Sons of Thunder

hungry.headline: Africa Kine in Harlem Returns to Its Humble Roots
hungry.name: Africa Kine
hungry.summary: The Senegalese restaurant has had three homes in 20 years. It reopened last September in a small space, offering stews by day and meats by night.
hungry.title: Africa Kine

hungry.headline: At Pravue Cafe, Albanian Home Cooking in Queens
hungry.name: Pravue Cafe and Albanian Grill
hungry.summary: Family recipes share the menu with dishes that lean to the West.
hungry.title: Pravue Cafe and Albanian Grill

hungry.headline: Taste of Samarkand Is a Silk Road Oasis in Queens
hungry.name: Taste of Samarkand
hungry.summary: The kosher Uzbek restaurant, which opened last August, upholds Uzbek food traditions.
hungry.title: Taste of Samarkand

hungry.headline: Zing’s Awesome Rice on the Lower East Side Finds Freshness in a Classic
hungry.name: Zing’s Awesome Rice
hungry.summary: A new, mostly takeout shop may make you rethink fried rice.
hungry.title: Zing’s Awesome Rice

hungry.headline: At Manila Social Club in Williamsburg, Rambling Filipino Cuisine
hungry.name: Manila Social Club
hungry.summary: Nostalgia suffuses the finest dishes from the chef Björn DelaCruz.
hungry.title: Manila Social Club

hungry.headline: At Kopitiam, the Art of Malaysian Snacking on the Lower East Side
hungry.name: Kopitiam
hungry.summary: A tiny coffee shop on Canal Street takes its sweets seriously.
hungry.title: Kopitiam

hungry.headline: Tito King’s Kitchen and Bago Join a Filipino Feast in the East Village
hungry.name: Bago
hungry.summary: Two new restaurants with modest, occasionally boundary-crossing delights set up shop around the neighborhood’s Little Manila.
hungry.title: Bago

hungry.headline: Grandchamps Welcomes You to Haiti, via Bedford-Stuyvesant
hungry.name: Grandchamps
hungry.summary: The chef, Shawn Brockman, has been trusted with his mother-in-law’s recipes, which may explain the generous, maternal quality of his dishes.
hungry.title: Grandchamps

hungry.headline: The Hot Dogs at Schaller’s Stube in Yorkville Have Been Working Out
hungry.name: Schaller’s Stube
hungry.summary: The sausages at this annex to Schaller & Weber, a venerable butcher shop on the Upper East Side, make a mockery of the buns meant to contain them.
hungry.title: Schaller’s Stube

hungry.headline: At Timna, the Middle East Visits the East Village
hungry.name: Timna
hungry.summary: The food is strongest when the chef, Nir Mesika, draws from his memories of growing up in Israel.
hungry.title: Timna

hungry.headline: Asian Spicy Curry Pops Up in Chinatown
hungry.name: Asian Spicy Curry
hungry.summary: The name is vague where the food is distinct: The curries draw from Malay, Indian and Chinese traditions, and are brimming over with spices rather than packing heat.
hungry.title: Asian Spicy Curry

hungry.headline: Safari Brings Somali Cuisine to Harlem
hungry.name: Safari
hungry.summary: Its East African flavors include bisbaas, a sauce of yogurt, cilantro and jalapeños.
hungry.title: Safari

hungry.headline: Goa Taco Takes Liberties on the Lower East Side
hungry.name: Goa Taco
hungry.summary: In lieu of tortillas, the fillings at this “semi-permanent” spot are served inside paratha, a many-layered Indian flatbread.
hungry.title: Goa Taco

hungry.headline: Lucy’s Vietnamese Kitchen Stays Close to Its Roots
hungry.name: Lucy’s Vietnamese Kitchen
hungry.summary: The restaurant in Bushwick, Brooklyn, a block away from the apartment where the chef grew up and still lives, is named for his grandmother.
hungry.title: Lucy’s Vietnamese Kitchen

hungry.headline: Sam’s Spring Roll Brings Innovation to the Lower East Side
hungry.name: Sam’s Spring Roll
hungry.summary: This underdressed snack counter is the work of a neighborhood chef, Samantha Chu.
hungry.title: Sam’s Spring Roll

hungry.headline: Babu Ji in the East Village Asserts Its Authority
hungry.name: Babu Ji
hungry.summary: The Manhattan restaurant offers Indian food dressed up brightly, with an attentiveness to fresh ingredients.
hungry.title: Babu Ji

hungry.headline: At the Food Sermon, Keeping the Faith in Crown Heights
hungry.name: The Food Sermon
hungry.summary: The Brooklyn restaurant offers Caribbean cuisine that will have you believing that food is a matter urgent for the soul.
hungry.title: The Food Sermon

hungry.headline: Toné-Café Brings Georgian Cuisine to Gramercy Park
hungry.name: Toné-Café
hungry.summary: Food comes quickly, on paper plates or encased in plastic tubs, originally destined for takeout. Nevertheless, it is a feast.
hungry.title: Toné-Café

hungry.headline: Chicks To Go Serves Chicken and Peruvian Pride in the Rockaways
hungry.name: Chicks To Go
hungry.summary: At the takeout shop, spicy, smoky pollo a la brasa is best chased by gulps of sweet lemon-verbena soda.
hungry.title: Chicks To Go

hungry.headline: Langos Truck Presents the Flavor of Hungary on Four Wheels
hungry.name: Langos Truck
hungry.summary: The food truck, which parks weekdays for lunch at different corners of New York City, proselytizes the power of its namesake offerings.
hungry.title: Langos Truck

hungry.headline: Kiki’s Greek Tavern Needs No Translation
hungry.name: Kiki’s
hungry.summary: The homey restaurant peeks through a mask of Chinese characters.
hungry.title: Kiki’s

hungry.headline: At the Handpulled Noodle, Mom Knows Best
hungry.name: The Handpulled Noodle
hungry.summary: In Harlem, the menu is mostly mix and match with a choice of noodles. The Xinjiang cuisine is inspired by the owner’s memories of his mother’s cooking.
hungry.title: The Handpulled Noodle

hungry.headline: At the Happiest Hour, a Cheeseburger Does a Star Turn
hungry.name: The Happiest Hour
hungry.summary: At this cocktail bar in Greenwich Village, a California-style burger makes everything seem O.K.
hungry.title: The Happiest Hour

hungry.headline: I Love Paraguay, an Ode to a Homeland
hungry.name: I Love Paraguay
hungry.summary: The restaurant in Sunnyside, Queens, started out as a bakery and has broadened its menu and ambition.
hungry.title: I Love Paraguay

pete.headline: Pasquale Jones Brings a Little Novelty to Little Italy
pete.name: Pasquale Jones
pete.summary: A new restaurant from the Charlie Bird team dabbles in pizzas and pastas, and specializes in wine.
pete.title: Pasquale Jones

pete.headline: At Mimi, French Food Is a Celebration of Appetite
pete.name: Mimi
pete.summary: An updated version of the bistro New Yorkers dream of finding in Greenwich Village.
pete.title: Mimi

pete.headline: At Nix, Vegetables Get a Dash of Sex
pete.name: Nix
pete.summary: This Greenwich Village restaurant joins a growing number of vegetarian places that celebrate verve more than virtue.
pete.title: Nix

pete.headline: Freek’s Mill Spins Romance Near a Superfund Site
pete.name: Freek’s Mill
pete.summary: A new restaurant by the Gowanus Canal in Brooklyn conjures up an agrarian ideal.
pete.title: Freek’s Mill

pete.headline: Grünauer Bistro Waltzes to a Time-Honored Tune
pete.name: Grünauer Bistro
pete.summary: A new Austrian restaurant on the Upper East Side could have come straight from Yorkville’s past.
pete.title: Grünauer Bistro

pete.headline: Poultry Has a Pedigree at Le Coq Rico
pete.name: Le Coq Rico
pete.summary: “Beautiful birds,” matured longer, are the attraction at this Manhattan spinoff of a Paris bistro.
pete.title: Le Coq Rico

pete.headline: At La Sirena, the Pleasures and Pitfalls of a Big Restaurant
pete.name: La Sirena
pete.summary: Mario Batali’s new place in Chelsea gives the main courses layers of complexity that go beyond standard trattoria cooking.
pete.title: La Sirena

pete.headline: Tiny Titans: Mr. Donahue’s and Ruffian Wine Bar
pete.name: Mr. Donahue’s
pete.summary: Outsize performances from a minuscule lunch counter in NoLIta and a skinny wine bar in the East Village.
pete.title: Mr. Donahue’s

pete.headline: Indian Accent Has a Cosmopolitan Twang
pete.name: Indian Accent
pete.summary: At a Midtown branch of a New Delhi restaurant, surprises are ladled out by an active imagination working in an Indian mode.
pete.title: Indian Accent

pete.headline: At Momofuku Nishi, David Chang’s Magic Shows a Little Wear
pete.name: Momofuku Nishi
pete.summary: The chef’s new restaurant in Chelsea can be a delight for the palate but tough on the ears and the seat.
pete.title: Momofuku Nishi

pete.headline: Looks Aren’t Everything at Café Altro Paradiso
pete.name: Café Altro Paradiso
pete.summary: The chefs Ignacio Mattos and Aidan O’Neal strip foods to their essences in SoHo.
pete.title: Café Altro Paradiso

pete.headline: Chaiwali, an Indian Restaurant That Feels Like Home
pete.name: Chaiwali
pete.summary: Relaxed, modern cooking and a stuffed peacock in the lower floors of a brownstone in Harlem.
pete.title: Chaiwali

pete.headline: The Best Comes in a Bun at Salvation Burger and Spotted Pig
pete.name: Salvation Burger
pete.summary: Sampling things on a bun at April Bloomfield’s latest restaurant, and checking in on her first.
pete.title: Salvation Burger

pete.headline: The Laws of Tuscan Eating at I Sodi in the West Village
pete.name: I Sodi
pete.summary: Rita Sodi, the chef and owner, taps into lessons learned from the farm north of Florence where she was raised.
pete.title: I Sodi

pete.headline: At Le Turtle, a French New Wave You Can Eat
pete.name: Le Turtle
pete.summary: A modern Lower East Side bistro bids au revoir to antique chic.
pete.title: Le Turtle

pete.headline: At Lilia in Brooklyn, Missy Robbins Is Cooking Pasta Again
pete.name: Lilia
pete.summary: This Italian restaurant in Williamsburg is something of a rarity: the sole focus of a talented midcareer chef.
pete.title: Lilia

pete.headline: Lowlife Plays It Cool on the Lower East Side
pete.name: Lowlife
pete.summary: At this new restaurant from a former Blanca chef, sensible minimalism clashes with a grand manner.
pete.title: Lowlife

pete.headline: Insa Brings Korean Cooking to Industrial Brooklyn
pete.name: Insa
pete.summary: At this crossover restaurant, traditional recipes are altered but their spirit is largely left intact.
pete.title: Insa

pete.headline: At High Street on Hudson, Prime Time Starts Early in the West Village
pete.name: High Street on Hudson
pete.summary: The chef Eli Kulp’s restaurant leads with its breads and breakfasts.
pete.title: High Street on Hudson

pete.headline: Bouley in TriBeCa Still Goes Its Own Way, Seductively
pete.name: Bouley
pete.summary: The downtown mainstay is an original, averse to trends.
pete.title: Bouley

pete.headline: Little Pepper Packs More Than Heat in College Point
pete.name: Little Pepper
pete.summary: For diners seeking nuance as well as powerful flavors in Sichuan dishes, a trip to northern Queens is in order.
pete.title: Little Pepper

pete.headline: Pizza Moto Comes to Rest in Brooklyn
pete.name: Pizza Moto @ John Grace Bakery
pete.summary: An oven on wheels now has a bricks-and-mortar restaurant where the creative pies are among New York’s brick-oven best.
pete.title: Pizza Moto @ John Grace Bakery

pete.headline: Llama Inn Lights the Way to Peru by Way of Williamsburg
pete.name: Llama Inn
pete.summary: In a building near the B.Q.E., a kitchen is producing a welcome interpretation of Peruvian cuisine.
pete.title: Llama Inn

pete.headline: Benoit in Midtown Is the Bistro That Will Take You to Paris
pete.name: Benoit
pete.summary: The menu includes dishes outside the bistro canon made almost as well as those inside it.
pete.title: Benoit

pete.headline: Meat Matters at Achilles Heel in Greenpoint and Resto in Kips Bay
pete.name: Achilles Heel
pete.summary: Carnivores can delight in the menus at a bar turned dinner destination and a restaurant with Belgian cuisine.
pete.title: Achilles Heel

pete.headline: Imagination Worth the Added Price at Midtown’s La Chine
pete.name: La Chine
pete.summary: From its caviar-filled eggs to its chocolate cake with sesame ganache, the upscale Chinese restaurant in the Waldorf Astoria offers sophisticated surprises.
pete.title: La Chine

pete.headline: At Thomas Keller’s Per Se, Slips and Stumbles
pete.name: Per Se
pete.summary: A new look at one of the nation’s landmark restaurants.
pete.title: Per Se

pete.headline: What a Difference Daytime Makes at Sadelle’s in SoHo
pete.name: Sadelle’s
pete.summary: Its kitschy afternoon clamor, with bagels and smoked fish, settles into evening elegance of butterflied trout and seared salmon steaks.
pete.title: Sadelle’s

pete.headline: At Señor Frog’s in Times Square, It’s Spring Break Forever
pete.name: Señor Frog’s
pete.summary: A chain restaurant popular with college students vacationing in the Caribbean comes to New York. Live a little.
pete.title: Señor Frog’s

pete.headline: At Wassail on the Lower East Side, in Praise of Smashed Apples
pete.name: Wassail
pete.summary: Hard cider — 12 on tap and a hundred in bottles — is the real passion on Orchard Street.
pete.title: Wassail

pete.headline: At Sessanta in SoHo and L’Amico in Chelsea, Italy Is Merely a Diversion
pete.name: Sessanta
pete.summary: Two hotel restaurants attract the kind of diners for whom the meal is a prelude to the night ahead.
pete.title: Sessanta

pete.headline: At Vaucluse, Michael White Takes a Step Toward France on the Upper East Side
pete.name: Vaucluse
pete.summary: Altamarea’s first French restaurant trots out the classics, which can be superb, quietly competent or oddly off kilter.
pete.title: Vaucluse

pete.headline: At Tempura Matsui in Murray Hill, the Pleasures Lie Within
pete.name: Tempura Matsui
pete.summary: On the $200, 10-course, no-choice, two-hour-long menu, the diaphanously thin batter is only the beginning.
pete.title: Tempura Matsui

pete.headline: Jams Gets a Reboot in Midtown
pete.name: Jams
pete.summary: Jonathan Waxman’s revival of a 1980s haunt trudges ahead in zombie-like fashion.
pete.title: Jams

pete.headline: Singapore Treats at Chomp Chomp in Greenwich Village
pete.name: Chomp Chomp
pete.summary: With the chef Simpson Wong’s ambitious hawker food menu, it’s like going from stall to stall without leaving your seat.
pete.title: Chomp Chomp

pete.headline: O Ya Riffs on Sushi and Sashimi in Kips Bay
pete.name: O Ya
pete.summary: Tim Cushman ignores most of the rules of Japanese cuisine in his long tasting menus.
pete.title: O Ya

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Chevalier in Midtown
pete.name: Chevalier
pete.summary: The new French restaurant in Midtown where luxury comes with a Baccarat heritage.
pete.title: Chevalier

pete.headline: Untitled at the Whitney in the Meatpacking District
pete.name: Untitled
pete.summary: Untitled, on the ground floor of Whitney Museum of American Art, gets its vibrancy and personality from the plates, with fruits and vegetables so ripe they’re ready to pop.
pete.title: Untitled

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: El Rey Coffee Bar & Luncheonette on the Lower East Side
pete.name: El Rey Coffee Bar and Luncheonette
pete.summary: A blend of California-Mexican cuisine with some of the less punitive flavors from the health-food and vegan disciplines.
pete.title: El Rey Coffee Bar and Luncheonette

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Lupulo in Chelsea
pete.name: Lupulo
pete.summary: The flavor and feel of a Portuguese beer hall come through loud and clear.
pete.title: Lupulo

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Blanca in Bushwick, Brooklyn
pete.name: Blanca
pete.summary: An extensive tasting menu features dishes that demonstrate the chef Carlo Mirarchi’s serious approach to luxuriously crafted food.
pete.title: Blanca

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Aquavit in Midtown
pete.name: Aquavit
pete.summary: Scandinavian cuisine that stands the test of time in Midtown.
pete.title: Aquavit

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Javelina in Gramercy Park
pete.name: Javelina
pete.summary: At Javelina, which bills itself as “New York’s first authentic Tex-Mex restaurant,” there are several fun mysteries to keep diners entertained.
pete.title: Javelina

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Fung Tu on the Lower East Side
pete.name: Fung Tu
pete.summary: Fung Tu has recovered from an uneven beginning, and the proximity of Danny Bowien’s Mission Chinese Food, by filling in the accents.
pete.title: Fung Tu

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Mu Ramen in Long Island City, Queens
pete.name: Mu Ramen
pete.summary: Mu Ramen has its own place now, a civilized spot for the slurping crowd.
pete.title: Mu Ramen

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Minton’s in Harlem
pete.name: Minton’s
pete.summary: At Minton’s, a jazz supper club, a band is onstage and on the table, Lowcountry cuisine, with its imprint of West African and Caribbean cooking.
pete.title: Minton’s

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Santina in the Meatpacking District
pete.name: Santina
pete.summary: Almost all the food at Santina pulses with the bright, refreshing flavors we crave in hot weather and, it turns out, in other months, too.
pete.title: Santina

pete.headline: Restaurant Review: Meat Hook Sandwich in Williamsburg, Brooklyn
pete.name: Meat Hook Sandwich
pete.summary: Big letters and bold flavors at Meat Hook Sandwich in Brooklyn.
pete.title: Meat Hook Sandwich

pete.headline: Restaurant Reviews: Limani and Estiatorio Milos in Midtown
pete.name: Limani
pete.summary: The two restaurants offer a double dose of Greek chic.
pete.title: Limani
